Ps_figure class

class ps_figure.ps_figure(axes_list, fname_out)

ps_figure objects hold a matplotlib figure and data required to populate it with a number of axes.

__init__(axes_list, fname_out)
Parameters

  • axes_list (list) – A list of ps_axis objects, each of which is used to generate an axis on the figure

  • fname_out (string) – Prefix for the output file of the figure. By default both a static (png) and moving (gif or mp4) image is generated

__weakref__

list of weak references to the object (if defined)

_axis_factory(axis_obj, _listlen)

Factory function that returns an object of the relevant subclass of NM_image, e.g. a 2D radial plot or a dispersion plot :param axis_obj: The ps_axis object dictates which subclass of NM_image object will be returned :type axis_obj: ps_axis object

Parameters

_listlen (int) – Internal counter that helps produce warning if 3D plot is part of a list of plots for a figure.

Returns obj

An object of the relevant subclass of NM_image

_gen_NM_img_objects()

Iteratively generating a NM_image object and running obj.make(); this updates obj to its final form,i.e. actually creating the plot. Note that these objects are stored in self.NM_img_objs for use in producing animations

_gen_animations()

Takes all of the axis objects stored in NM_img_objs and animates them if that is feasible.

plot()

Create the different NM_image subclass objects (e.g. dispersion, 2D_radial) from the inputted PS_axis objs This also adds the plots from each of these subclasses to the overall figure
